definition: A reflection or image that is formed when light bounces off a surface, typically used to describe the visual representation of an object or person in a reflective surface.

examples.english: The mirror image shows my face.

examples.german: Sie betrachtete ihr Spiegelbild und lächelte.
examples.english: She looked at her reflection in the mirror and smiled.

examples.german: Das Spiegelbild des Baumes war im Wasser zu sehen.
examples.english: The reflection of the tree could be seen in the water.

examples.german: Er konnte sein Spiegelbild nicht erkennen, da der Spiegel verschmutzt war.
examples.english: He couldn't recognize his reflection because the mirror was dirty.

examples.german: Das Spiegelbild des Gebäudes war beeindruckend.
examples.english: The reflection of the building was impressive.
